raw_text:
Elvis 'set for chart hat-trick'
 
 The late US legend Elvis Presley is likely to score his third UK number one single in three weeks on Sunday, according to early sales figures.
 
 The king of rock 'n' roll has already had consecutive chart-toppers with Jailhouse Rock and One Night. A Fool Such As I, the next in a series of 18 reissues, is on course to beat the Chemical Brothers to the top. But his next single, It's Now Or Never, will face a challenge from tsunami charity single Grief Never Grows Old. Sir Cliff Richard, Russell Watson, Boy George, Bill Wyman and members of the Bee Gees, the Beach Boys, America and the Eagles are expected to feature on the charity song.
 
 Bookmakers have offered odds of 10/1 for all Presley's 18 hits to go back to number one. A Fool Such As I would become the 1,001st number one single in UK chart history after One Night took the 1,000th place on Sunday. The latest release is currently outselling the Chemical Brothers' comeback single Galvanize plus other new releases from Athlete, Ciara and Feeder. Presley's 18 original number ones are being reissued as limited release singles, with fans eager to buy the set to fill a collector's box that went on sale in the first week. Record company Sony BMG is now manufacturing 5,000 more copies of each single than originally planned to meet demand, taking the total number of copies of each song on sale to about 28,000.

The reissued singles have been selling well, surpassing even new releases from other artists like Athlete and Ciara.
1,001st chart-topping song is being reached with this release.
The record company is responding to high demand by increasing the number of copies available for purchase.

Singles like "Jailhouse Rock" and "One Night" are already charting well.
The Chemical Brothers' latest single, "Grief Never Grows Old," could challenge this position.
Presley's music is being reissued in limited quantities to ensure a large number of copies can be sold quickly.
Record companies are producing 5,000 more copies than originally planned for each album to meet demand.
The total number of copies sold for the entire album has been set at about 28,000.

The latest release outsells other new releases and fans are eagerly purchasing the reissued singles sets.
Sony BMG is manufacturing more copies due to increased demand.

The next single, "It's Now Or Never," faces competition from a tsunami charity single.

deepseek-r1:1.5b: Elvis Presley is set to chart three songs in three weeks, aiming to become the first artist ever to reach number one.
His next single, "A Fool Such As I," will face competition from "Grief Never Grows Old."
Bookmakers offer odds of 10/1 for his hits to be number one singles, with a target to reach 1,001st.
He's reissuing 18 previous hits as limited releases, aiming to fill a collector's box with sales reaching around 28,000 copies each.
tinyllama:1.1b: Elvis 'set for chart hat-trick' according to early sales figures as bookmakers offer odds of 10/1 for all his 18 hits to return to number one.

With FooL Such As I set to beat Chemical Brothers' comeback single Galvanize and other new releases from Athletes, Ciara, Feeder, and a limited edition collector's box featuring the 18 original number ones being sold out in just two weeks, fans are eagerly looking for reissues of his chart-toppers.

Elvis' upcoming singles It's Now Or Never, which will feature on the charity song Grief Never Grows Old alongside Sir Cliff Richard, Russell Watson, Boy George, Bill Wyman, and members of the Bee Gees, are expected to follow suit.
As bookmakers offer odds of 10/1 for all his hits to return to number one, it's clear that Elvis is poised for a third UK number one single in just three weeks.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The chart-topping achievements of US legend Elvis Presley are set to continue with his third number one single set for release next week.
The King of Rock 'n' Roll has already enjoyed consecutive hits in the UK with Jailhouse Rock and One Night.
Released on September 25, A Fool Such As I is expected to secure his third top spot on Sunday, October 17.

In addition to the new single, Presley will also face tough competition from several charity singles, including Grief Never Grows Old, sung by Sir Cliff Richard, Russell Watson, Boy George, Bill Wyman and members of the Bee Gees.
The song aims to raise funds for tsunami relief efforts and is set to be released on November 24th.

Bookmakers have offered odds of 10/1 for Presley's hit collection to return to number one, with odds on all 18 songs being higher than the current top positions held by Jake Gyllenhaal and Mumford & Sons.
However, bookies may be underestimating the power of his legacy as a music icon who has sold millions worldwide over the years.

Furthermore, fans can expect to purchase limited-edition singles featuring previously released songs such as A Fool Such As I and Galvanize plus other new releases from Athlete, Ciara, Feeder and Presley.
The set will be made available for sale in the first week of October and is expected to have a total number of 28,000 copies manufactured.

Bookmakers have offered odds of 10/1 for all 18 of Presley's hits to go back to number one in the UK chart history.
Fans are eagerly buying the limited-release singles to complete their collection of his original number ones.
Sony BMG is now manufacturing more copies than planned due to high demand, with a total of about 28,000 copies of each song on sale.
